Summary Nicole Flammer is a Senior Consultant in the SAP Change and Learning practice within IBM Global Business Services. Nicole has been involved in multiple custom SAP implementations at all project stages from pre-blueprint to post go-live. She has supported clients in the Life Sciences, Pharmaceuticals, Distribution, Hospitality, and Agribusiness industries and has excelled in a variety of roles, including training development, testing, functional consulting, and test management. She has experience in designing training curriculum and standards, defining business processes, and leading others in the training design process. Nicole has developed training materials for SAP FI/CO, CRM, MDG, BOBJ, and Siebel Hospitality. She also has previous experience in Lean Six Sigma processes and was certified as a Lean Six Sigma Green Belt from United Airlines. Nicole graduated from Northwestern University with a B.S. in Industrial Engineering. Experience Senior Consultant IBM July 2013  – Present (2 years 2 months) Greater Chicago Area Nicole currently works on training engagements for SAP and Oracle implementation projects. She has worked on multiple full life cycle projects and has been responsible for: 
• Defining standard documentation and reporting procedures for training materials using best practice methodologies. 
• Assessing training and curriculum needs across international markets. 
• Delivering training on training tools to project teams. 
• Managing development of training content across multiple process teams (including training concept decks, uPerform business process procedures, uPerform web-based trainings, and training environment data and exercise guides). 
• Supporting end user training in a global environment. 
• Assessing gaps in current training materials and identifying strategies in redesigning training programs. Consulting by Degrees Consultant IBM July 2011  –  June 2013  (2 years) Greater Chicago Area Nicole completed the Consulting by Degrees program at IBM in two years, rotating through a variety of roles and responsibilities on SAP implementation projects. In different roles, Nicole: 
• Managed development for all training content on business processes in SAP CRM, SAP BOBJ, and SAP MDG (creating concept decks, uPerform simulations, and uPerform web based trainings).  
• Served as a functional consultant on a PTD (Plan to Distribute) team, writing and executing test scripts focusing on areas within SAP MM and SAP SD, conducting functional unit testing, integration testing, regression testing, volume testing, and performance testing.  
• Coordinated SAP testing efforts for 30 sites in 14 countries across supply chain process streams by developing a test plan, managing a test plan in HPQC, developing and publishing daily test execution and defect metrics, completing test validation, and delivering a playbook to document all testing responsibilities. 
• Investigated SAP global template methodologies for use in extending current project solutions into a global template, managing project documentation and facilitating development of workshop materials. Industrial Engineering/Continuous Improvement Intern United Airlines March 2010  –  September 2010  (7 months) Greater Chicago Area Nicole completed multiple internships at United Airlines, gaining exposure to airline operations and Lean Six Sigma projects. During her internships at United, Nicole: 
• Obtained Lean Six Sigma Green Belt certification by managing a project to significantly reduce annual standby meal management labor costs at O’Hare International Airport. 
• Developed an Excel toolkit detailing a standard process for meal planning in support of a Lean Six Sigma Black Belt project and trained a team of six project managers and other Onboard Services team members to use the toolkit for all future meal redesigns.  
• Obtained operational, customer service, and vendor management experience in negotiating with the airline’s caterer over standby labor scheduling and completing an intensive observation of airplane turn activities at O’Hare. Summary Maxwell Cohen is a Consultant in the Application Innovation Services of IBM Global Business Services. He specializes in Java, JavaScript, Excel scripting, web based testing, and process improvement. Max is a 2012 graduate of Purdue University, with a BS in Industrial Engineering with a Specialization in Software Engineering and minors in Philosophy and Statistics. Summary My studies as a Bachelor of Science candidate in both Industrial Management and Supply Chain Information and Analytics and minor studies in both Management Information Systems and Analytical Consulting from Purdue University have provided me with the necessary skills and strategies that I am comfortable transferring to my future career; I chose this program because it encompasses my analytical, personal, and technical skills all into one useful package. 
 
I have been had the opportunity to implement process improvement initiatives through two summer internships with two great companies. At ArcelorMittal, I was able to redefine metrics to better assess shipping performance and provide daily data to ensure improved shipping performance. At Boeing, I used the SDLC to design and create a secure database which standardized a more efficient process to track vital procurement information that was easily accessible to various business units. 
 
I look forward to utilizing what I have learned in my experiences from these internships as well as in the classroom and applying that to my first full time position as a Consulting by Degrees Consultant with IBM starting in July 2015.

Summary Jamilah Matthews has 10 years of professional experience, including as an Information Technology Advisory Services Consultant, a Strategy Analyst, and a Senior Consultant in industries including Financial Services, Insurance, and Aerospace. She graduated from The Pennsylvania State University with a Bachelor of Science in Security & Risk Analysis from the College of Information Science and Technology in December 2011. 
 
Jamilah’s consulting experience includes three full years at IBM and three summer internships between PwC and KPMG. She specializes in business analysis, data analysis, and project management assistance. Her prior experiences are from the financial services, insurance, and aerospace industries. She also has experience in data modeling, data mapping, requirements gathering, gap analysis, and business use case development. While at KPMG, she was one of 14 interns selected to participate in the firm’s Global Internship Program in which she interned in Dublin, Ireland. Currently, she desires to gain more experience in the Finance, Risk & Fraud domains. She is well-organized, pleasant, and has demonstrated her ability to perform and deliver under pressure in time-sensitive environments.  
 
As a member of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Incorporated, she is dedicated to sisterhood, scholarship and community service. She served as the Vice President of the Student Minority Advisory and Recruitment Team. As an executive member of SMART, she helped plan and execute programs designed to recruit minority students to Penn State. On April 25, 2010, she was crowned Miss Black Penn State 2010. Currently, Jamilah’s interest includes mentoring, photography, Reiki healing, and yoga. Experience Consulting by Degrees Consultant IBM August 2014  – Present (1 year 1 month) Greater Atlanta Area Most of my time spent as an IBM Consultant has been working on the IBM Events Team, which creates the apps and websites for the four tennis Grand Slams, the US Open and Masters golf tournaments, the China Open, and the Tony Awards. 
 
I joined this team in October 2013, and immediately began testing for the Australian Open tennis event, determining defects for developers. I was able to expand that role into writing test cases for other testers to run. For the Masters golf tournament, I continued testing and writing test cases. Experience Consulting By Degrees Consultant IBM July 2015  – Present (2 months) Washington D.C. Metro Area IE/Supplier Management Intern Boeing May 2014  –  August 2014  (4 months) Seattle, WA As a part of the analytics team in Supplier Management of Boeing Commercial Airplanes, I worked on multiple valuable projects throughout the course of my internship. The following gives a brief summary of my experience: 
- The main project that I was presented with was the task of lowering supplier lead times. It was a complex situation with a lot of variables and challenges, but in the end I was able to create a dynamic lead time model that utilized a ranking algorithm and reduced the suppliers' lead time by over 30%. I then collaborated with TMX Aerospace to create an automated lead time matrix in which suppliers would use to place orders.  
- My second project was to do an analysis on the current metal inventory. Through the use of access and excel, I was able to identify over 100,000 lbs of remnant pieces that were obsolete for operation. 
- Finally, I was asked to look into one of the inventory warehouses in the supply chain. This warehouse was in a poor strategical location and management wanted me to find out the logistics of possibly shutting it down. I identified that 24% of the part numbers accounted for 80% of the inventory. I then focused on those part numbers and made recommendations to use/scrap/relocate that material over the next several years. Analyst Connors Group January 2013  –  August 2013  (8 months) At Connors Group, I got my first taste of consulting and loved it. Interacting with clients on a day to day basis sharpened my communication skills and made me much more professional. While I was there, I got to work on some beneficial projects. The following is a summary of my experience: 
- When working for a convenience store chain, I studied the store's pack out process of non-vendor items that were delivered to the store twice a week. Using a predetermined motion time system, I developed over 15 engineering labor standards. 
- Across several projects, I conducted multiple time studies and analyzed the data to find underlying customer patterns and trends. This analysis gave the clients vital insight to their customers' shopping patterns. 
- Throughout the course of my internship, I collaborated with different team members to work on numerous process improvement ideas that saved clients substantial amounts of money. 
- Finally, I got the privilege to work on several projects with some of the largest apparel retailers in the country. I even worked internationally in Canada with a family run grocery store. Summary I grew up on a large working family ranch in Southwest Colorado, known for its emphasis on sustainable food production and the integration of three generations of family members. Through this, I have worked extensively in entrepreneurship, small business development, human resources, public speaking, direct marketing, communication, and management up close since the age of six. As a senior at the University of Pennsylvania, I studied International Relations, focusing on trade and investment between China and Latin America. After graduation, I became a consultant for IBM, within their Global Business Services North America division.
